case_title: DR. ABDUL SAMI vs The DIRECTOR, HEALTH SERVICES, BALUCHISTAN

key_arguments.appellant: Entitlement to pay scale of Senior Class-I post due to officiating appointments.
key_arguments.respondent: Appointments were temporary and governed by Fundamental Rule 35, restricting pay to substantive grade.

key_findings.appointment_nature: Officiating, temporary, or ad hoc basis without substantive promotion.
key_findings.rule_application: Fundamental Rule 35 allows pay fixation below the prescribed scale for officiating posts.
key_findings.competency_issue: Director was not authorized to promote or appoint to Senior Class-I posts.

precedents_cited.case_name: Muhammad Hashim v. Post Master-General and others
The State of Pakistan v. Mehraj Din
Dr. Muhammad Amin Durrani v. Government of West Pakistan
Syed Muhammad Ashraf Shah v. Province of West Pakistan

summary: The petition was dismissed as the appellant's appointments to higher posts were temporary and did not confer substantive rights or entitlements to higher pay scales. Fundamental Rule 35 was upheld as the basis for restricting pay to the substantive grade.
